Target: OntoPlanningRegulations is an ontology developed to describe the regulations imposed for urban planning purposes.

Comment: URARegulation defines all formalised Urban Redevelopment Agency regulations, e.g. Development Control Plans, Urban Deign Guidelines, Height Control plans and others.
Label: URA Regulation

Comment: Area Regulation defines URA regulations that have geospatial boundary. In other words, these are regulations whose rules apply only to entities within the regulation geospatial boundary.
Label: Area Regulation

Comment: Detail Control area regulations may be any of the other area regulation subclasses that requires individual assessment.
Label: Detailed Control

Comment: Height Control Plan as defined in https://data.gov.sg/dataset/master-plan-2019-sdcp-building-height-control-layer
Label: Height Control Plan

Comment: Landed housing areas as  defined  by https://data.gov.sg/dataset/master-plan-2019-sdcp-landed-housing-area-layer
Label: Landed Housing Area

Comment: Street Block Plans as defined in https://www.ura.gov.sg/Corporate/Planning/Master-Plan/Control-Plans/Street-Block-and-Envelope-Control-Plans/list-of-street-block-envelope-control-plans
Label: Street Block Plan

Comment: Urban Design Areas as defined in https://data.gov.sg/dataset/master-plan-2019-sdcp-urban-design-guideline-layer
Label: Urban Design Area

Comment: Urban Design Guidelines as defined in  https://www.ura.gov.sg/Corporate/Guidelines/Urban-Design.
Label: Urban Design Guideline

Comment: Type regulation represent URA regulations that apply to entities based on the entities' type. In other words, type regulation rules will apply to urban entity that has the same type. For instance, a Commercial development control plan will apply to plots with commercial zoning type.
Label: Type Regulation

Comment: Development Control Plan as defined by URA. Developemnt Control Plans provide development control guidelines and parameters for developments. It explains the parameters such as building setbacks, building coverage, intensity and height in detail.
Label: Development Control Plan

Comment: Road Categories as defined by URA. Each road may have a road category, that may affect the required road buffer, allowed number of storeys, allowed programmes.
Label: Road Category
plot abuts good class bungalow area
plot in good class bungalow area
